Package om.stdcomponent

Standard question components provided by the Om system to work with the standard question implementation in om.stdquestion.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
Labelable Interface implemented by components that can accept a LabelComponent.
 

Class Summary
AdvancedFieldComponent A text field that can allow the user to enter superscripts and subscripts, or performs automatic subscript formatting for chemical formulae.
Subscript and superscript modes can be changed using linked checkboxes or by using the up and down arrow keys.
AppletComponent Inserts a pushbutton that users can press to open the an applet specified in the <applet> tag component.
AudioComponent Allows users to play MP3 audio files.
BoxComponent A top-level box that goes within the root <question> tag (after the <layout> section).
BreakComponent A line break that forces following text or components to start a new line (consider also GapComponent which is the same thing but with some blank space).
ButtonComponent A standard XHTML button.
CanvasComponent Represents a Java BufferedImage so that you can draw graphics from Java code.
CentreComponent Centres contained text or components.
CheckboxComponent A checkbox component.
ComponentRegistry Just a list of standard components.
DragBoxComponent A component that can be dropped onto DropBoxComponents.
DropBoxComponent A component onto which DragBoxComponents may be dropped.
DropdownComponent A component that produces a dropdown box with several available options.
EditFieldComponent Standard XHTML edit field for entering a single line or multiple lines of plain text.
EmphasisComponent Emphasises the contained text (by default rendered as bold).
EquationComponent Represents equations that are produced as bitmaps.
FlashComponent Represents a flash applet

GapComponent A gap between lines of text or components (like BreakComponent but with some blank space too).
IfComponent Conditionally displays content depending on settings.
ImageComponent Represents a displayed image from a file

IndentComponent Indents contained text or components.
JMEComponent Inserts a pushbutton that users can press to open the JME (Java Molecular Editor) component.
LabelComponent Indicates that the contents are a label for another control.
LayoutGridComponent A layout grid that arranges child components in a certain number of equal-size columns.
LinkComponent Inserts a link on the web page.
ListComponent This is a component to layout bulletted and numbered lists.
The list component will arrange the components directly below as a list.
MathMLEquationComponent Represents equations described in MathML format.
RadioBoxComponent A radiobox component.
RightComponent Right-aligns contained text or components.
RootComponent Represents the document root.
TableComponent This is a component to layout components as a table.
The table component can only contain <row> and <title> elements directly.
Rows can only contain <t> (text) elements (each defines a cell), but these can contain things such as images, text input areas and also formatting elements such as <centre>
The title is placed as a string a the top of the table and is set to be the caption for improved accessibillity.
TextComponent Represents ordinary text (and arbitrary contained components).
TextEquationComponent Represents simple equations that can be produced as XHTML.
WordSelectComponent A paragraph of plain text with selectable words.
 

Package om.stdcomponent Description

Standard question components provided by the Om system to work with the standard question implementation in om.stdquestion.

These components (all subclasses of QComponent) implement the default XML tags that are allowed in question.xml. Components have a Java file and may also have a CSS and JavaScript file of the same name; if included, these will be automatically placed into output which uses the component.

Creating new components

Components are listed in ComponentRegistry.java and new components created in this package should be added to the list in there, as well as the index of XML tags in package.html for om.stdquestion.
